Description: Toyobo Co. Ltd. of Japan and its American subsidiary Toyobo U.S.A. Inc. agreed to pay $66 million to resolve claims under the False Claims Act that they sold defective Zylon fiber used in bullet proof vests that the United States purchased for federal, state, local, and tribal law enforcement agencies.

Toyobo Co. agreed to pay in settlement of a class action suit alleging that the material used in bullet proof vests lost effectiveness before the end of the warranty period. This payment was to Massachusetts law enforcement agencies that had joined the class action suit.
Toyobo Corp. agreed to pay $427,000 to four Arkansas state law-enforcement agencies to settle claims over faulty vests made from Zylon fibers.
